summary: This document appears to be internal email correspondence from July 24, 2019, regarding a psychological assessment (SRA) of an inmate at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York. The emails discuss which staff member should complete a report following an incident, referencing that a Chief Psychologist saw the inmate for the SRA the previous day.

persons.name: Chief Psychologist
persons.role: Chief Psychologist at Metropolitan Correctional Center
persons.context: Referenced as having conducted a Suicide Risk Assessment (SRA) on an inmate the day before the email correspondence. The email discussion centers on whether this individual should complete a follow-up report.

events.title: Suicide Risk Assessment Conducted
events.description: A Chief Psychologist conducted a Suicide Risk Assessment (SRA) on an inmate at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

events.title: Internal Email Discussion on Incident Report
events.description: Internal email correspondence discusses which staff member should complete a report related to an incident, given the Chief Psychologist's recent SRA assessment.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The document is dated July 24, 2019, which is the day after Jeffrey Epstein's arrest and during his incarceration.
It references a Suicide Risk Assessment (SRA) conducted on an inmate the previous day (July 23, 2019).
The correspondence is between Bureau of Prisons staff discussing procedural follow-up after an incident involving an inmate.
The location is the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, where Jeffrey Epstein was held.
The document is marked 'CONFIDENTIAL' and is part of the SDNY evidence collection (SDNY_00011835).
